intro: Spermacoce bambusicola, commonly known as the bamboo milkweed, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, climbing stems that often twine around supports. The leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the wet season. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
